verses.verse: Social Evils Denounced (Prov 3.27; Isa 32.7; Hos 7.6, 7; Nah 1.11) Woe to those who devise wickedness and evil deeds (Cn: Heb work evil) on their beds! When the morning dawns, they perform it, because it is in their power.
(1 Kings 21.1-15; Isa 5.8; Am 8.4) They covet fields and seize them, houses and take them away; they oppress householder and house, people and their inheritance.

(Deut 28.48; Isa 2.11, 12; Jer 18.11; Am 3.1, 2; 5.13) Therefore thus says the LORD: Now, I am devising against this family an evil from which you cannot remove your necks, and you shall not walk arrogantly, for it will be an evil time.

(Isa 24.3; Jer 4.13; 6.12; 8.10; Mic 1.8; Hab 2.6) On that day they shall take up a taunt song against you and wail with bitter lamentation and say, “We are utterly ruined; the LORD (Heb he) alters the inheritance of my people; how he removes it from me! Among our captors (Cn: Heb the rebellious) he parcels out our fields.”
(Josh 18.4, 10) Therefore you will have no one in the LORD’s assembly to allot you a piece of land.
(Isa 30.10; Am 2.12; 7.16; Mic 3.6; 6.16) “Do not preach”—thus they preach— “one should not preach of such things; disgrace will not overtake us.”
Should this be said, O house of Jacob? Is the LORD’s patience exhausted? Are these his doings? Do not my words do good to one who walks uprightly?

But you rise up against my people (Cn: Heb But yesterday my people rose) as an enemy; you strip the robe from the peaceful, (Cn: Heb from before a garment) from those who pass by trustingly with no thought of war.
The women of my people you drive out from their pleasant houses; from their young children you take away my glory forever.
(Lev 18.25, 28, 29; Deut 12.9; Ps 106.38) Arise and go, for this is no place to rest, because of uncleanness that destroys with a violent destruction.
(Isa 28.7; 30.10, 11; Jer 5.13, 31) If someone were to go about uttering empty falsehoods, saying, “I will preach to you of wine and strong drink,” such a one would be the preacher for this people!

A Promise for the Remnant of Israel (Jer 23.3; Mic 4.6, 7; 5.7, 8; 7.18) I will surely gather all of you, O Jacob; I will gather the survivors of Israel; I will set them together like sheep in a fold, like a flock in its pasture; it will resound with people.
(Isa 52.12; Hos 3.5) The one who breaks out will go up before them; they will break through and pass the gate, going out by it. Their king will pass on before them, the LORD at their head.
